rationale: Digital communication plays a vital role in the field of electronic communication systems which includes wired and wireless communications viz. telecommunication, radio, mobile and satellite communication systems. This course will enable Electronics and Communication engineering diploma engineers to maintain digital communication and networking equipment and circuits used in the practical field. This course also lays the foundation to understand the advanced communication courses in the subsequent semesters.
competency: The course content should be taught and implemented with the aim to develop different types of skills so that students are able to acquire following competency: Maintain electronic digital communication systems.

courseOutcomes.description: Define digital communication and its characteristics
Explain the function of various bandpass modulation techniques
Discuss various coding techniques used in data transmission
Distinguish between various multiplexing and multiple access techniques

practicalExercises.description: Study the Elements of Digital Communication system with its block diagram: source, channel, transmitter and receiver
Generate and analyze the waveform of Amplitude Shift Keying (ASK) modulator and demodulator
Generate and analyze the waveform of Frequency Shift Keying (FSK) modulator and demodulator
Generate and analyze the waveform of Phase Shift Keying (PSK) modulator and demodulator
Identify the different phase shifts generated in Quadrature Phase Shift Keying Modulation
Sketch the constellation diagram for 8-Phase Shift Keying modulation
Check the performance of 8-Phase Shift Keying modulation and demodulation
Check the performance of Minimum Shift Keying modulation and demodulation
Generate Huffman code using relevant simulation software
Generate Shannon Fano code using relevant simulation software
Generate Error correcting code using relevant simulation software
Generate Error Detecting code using relevant simulation software
Test the performance for 4 input Time Division Multiplexing (TDM) Circuit
Test the performance for 2 input Frequency Division Multiplexing (FDM) Circuit
Generate Time Division Multiplexing (TDM) signal using relevant simulation software
Generate Frequency Division Multiplexing (FDM) signal using relevant simulation software
Familiarization with Arduino/Raspberry Pi and perform necessary software installation
To interface LED/Buzzer with Arduino/Raspberry Pi and write a program to turn ON LED for 1 second after every two second
Capturing the Packets using Wireshark
Study of the features of firewall in providing network security and to set Firewall Security in windows
Steps to ensure Security of any one web browser (Mozilla Firefox/Google Chrome)
File formats supported by MATLAB for signal processing
Conversion of Audio & Video files into various format using 'Format Factory'
Audio signal Processing using MATLAB
Video signal Processing using MATLAB

performanceIndicators.indicator: Operate the equipment setup or circuit

hardware: Spectrum analyzer, 9 kHz to 1.5 GHz Frequency Range, Typical -135 dBm Displayed Average Noise Level (DANL)
CRO - Dual trace, 20 MHz Choice of any one built-in option, 30 MHz Bandwidth
RF generator/wideband oscillator Wide Frequency Range 100 KHz to 150 MHz
Function Generator: Frequency Range 0.1 Hz to 1 MHZ

Digital Communication Trainer, In-build internal data generator, Type of Modulations and Demodulations: ASK, FSK, BPSK, QPSK, 8-PSK, 16-QAM , Time Division Multiplexing -Demultiplexing and Frequency Division Multiplexing -Demultiplexing

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Prepare the list of equipment required in laboratory session

unitOutcomes.description: Signal and its classification
Explain function of the given block of digital communication system
Describe with sketches the given type of characteristics of communication channels

topics.title: Signal and Classification: Continuous time and discrete time signals, Real and complex signals, Deterministic and random signals, Even and odd signals, Energy and power signals, Singularity function, Unit step function, Unit impulse function, Unit ramp function
Elements of Digital Communication system with its block diagram: source, channel, transmitter and receiver
Communication channel characteristics: bit rate, baud rate, bandwidth, repeater distance, applications

unitOutcomes.description: ASK signal generation and detection - Modulation and Demodulation of ASK
FSK signal generation and detection - Modulation and Demodulation of FSK
PSK signal generation and detection with its functional diagram
Comparison between ASK, FSK and PSK
Principle & process of QPSK signal generation and detection with its constellation diagram and waveform
Principle, constellation diagram and waveforms of 8-PSK
Principle, constellation diagram and waveforms of 16-QAM
Principle, constellation diagram and waveforms of MSK

topics.title: Amplitude Shift Keying (ASK)
Frequency Shift Keying (FSK)
Phase Shift Keying (PSK)
Quadrature Phase shift Keying (QPSK)
8-ary PSK
16-Quadrature Amplitude Modulator (QAM)
Minimum Shift Keying (MSK)

unitOutcomes.description: Significance of probability in communication
Entropy and Information with its physical significance, their units
Channel Capacity in terms of SNR and its importance
Define Huffman code, Error detecting and correcting code (Parity Codes, Hamming Codes)

topics.title: Probability
Entropy and Information
Mutual Information
Channel Capacity
Huffman Coding and Shannon Fano coding
Error, types of error
Define error detection and list types of error detection
Define error correction and list common error correcting code

unitOutcomes.description: Classify the given multiplexing techniques based on domain of working
Choose the suitable multiplexing techniques for multiplexing the given number of signals
Interpret the given multiplexing hierarchy
Contrast the given type of multiplexing techniques and multiple access techniques
Describe the procedure to troubleshoot the specified multiplexing circuit

topics.title: Need and methods of multiplexing: Time Division Multiplexing (TDM), Frequency Division Multiplexing (FDM), Code Division multiplexing (CDM), definition, block diagram and their comparison
E1 and T1- carrier multiplexing hierarchy
Access techniques: Need and methods - Time Division Multiple Access (TDMA), Frequency Division Multiple Access (FDMA), Code Division Multiple Access (CDMA)

unitOutcomes.description: Network Security
Digital telephone exchange
Wireless multimedia communication
Internet of things

topics.title: Security Components: Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability, Threats, Security policy and its elements, Steps in Cracking a Network, Types of Malwares, Types of Attacks
Block diagram of Digital telephone exchange, elements of hardware sub systems: DLU, LTG, SN, CP
Form of information representation: text, audio, image and video, multimedia applications, different standard formats of audio, image and video
IoT - Concept, Key Features, Characteristics, Advantages and Disadvantages, Technology

studentActivities: Teacher guided tutorial exercises to solve problems based on all units
Implement all circuits on breadboard and verify the design
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/subtopics
'L' in section No. 4 means different types of teaching methods that are to be employed by teachers to develop the outcomes
About 20% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature can be given to the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different assessment methods
With respect to section No.10, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities

microProjects.title: Explore ASK Modulator and Demodulator circuit
microProjects.description: Hands-on exploration of ASK modulation techniques

microProjects.title: Explore FSK Modulator and Demodulator circuit
microProjects.description: Hands-on exploration of FSK modulation techniques

microProjects.title: Explore circuit of PSK Modulator and Demodulator
microProjects.description: Hands-on exploration of PSK modulation techniques

microProjects.title: Explore circuit of Modulator and Demodulator (modem)
Mini project should be prepared based on - Using Arduino or Raspberry Pi boards and its software platforms
Prepare a brief report to illustrate digital communication based applications being used in various sectors
microProjects.description: Research project covering applications in Banking, Medicine, Defense, E-commerce, Education, Environment, Industries etc.

microProjects.title: Industrial visit to telephone exchange and mobile switching center / EPABX manufacturing unit

programOutcomes.description: Basic & Discipline specific knowledge: Apply knowledge of basic mathematics, science and engineering fundamentals and engineering specialization to solve the engineering problems
Problem Analysis: Identify and analyze well defined engineering problems using codified standard methods
Design/ Development of Solution: Design solutions for well-defined technical problems and assist with the design of systems, components or processes to meet specified needs
Engineering Tools, Experimentation & Testing: Apply modern engineering tools and relevant technique to conduct standard tests and measurements
Engineering practices for society, sustainability & environment: Apply relevant technology in context of society, sustainability, environment and ethical practices
Project Management: Use engineering management principles individually, as a team member or a leader to manage projects and effectively communicate about well-defined engineering activities
Life-long learning: Ability to analyze individual needs and engage in updating in the context of technological changes
